overview: To reduce unwanted noise and help you focus on what matters most, we’re removing notifications generated from mentions in commit messages. Previously, mentioning a user or team in a commit message (e.g., fixes bug for @username) triggered a notification, just like in issues or pull requests.

detailed_explanation.title: Overview
bullets: To reduce unwanted noise and help you focus on what matters most, we’re removing notifications generated from mentions in commit messages. Previously, mentioning a user or team in a commit message (e.g., fixes bug for @username) triggered a notification, just like in issues or pull requests.
Editor’s note (November 7, 2025): Updated terminology for the type of notifications.

detailed_explanation.title: What’s changing
bullets: On December 8th, Users and teams will no longer receive notifications when mentioned in a commit message. Mentions in issues, pull requests, and discussions will continue to trigger notifications.

detailed_explanation.title: How to give feedback
bullets: If you have any feedback or questions, feel free to drop a comment in our Community discussion .
